page.title: 04...LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Most of the area was farmland and was sparsely populated. Shard End was once part of the Manor of Castle Bromwich while Firs Hall once stood on the Firs Housing Estate. After the 1939-45 War Shard End Estate was built following compulsory purchase orders being made. All that remains of its past are a few cottages in Packington Ave. and School Lane. Some road names remind us of its farm history, like Brookmeadow and Hernefield. Likewise Arkle Croft and Sandown Road remind us of Bromford Estate's racing past. A race course existed from 1895-1965. Castle Bromwich Hall built about 1600,is owned by Bovis who bought it from the Bradford family, the manor's previous owners. The Parish Church was built in 1726-31. Documents show a chapel existed in 1175 in Castle Bromwich. The last piece of open land here is Hodge Hill Common.
